summary: This document is a series of email exchanges between attorney Michael Bachner and a government prosecutor regarding an attorney proffer for an unnamed female client (Ms. =). The emails discuss the content of the proffer, clarify details about the client's visits to Jeffrey Epstein properties, and arrange for a potential direct interview with the client. The communications are legally privileged and discuss evidentiary protections.

persons.name: Michael Bachner
persons.context: Attorney representing an unnamed female client (Ms. =) in communications with a government prosecutor regarding an attorney proffer and potential client interview.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned indirectly as the owner of properties (New York mansion, Palm Beach residence, New Mexico ranch, Little St. James Island, Great St. James Island, Paris residence) that are the subject of investigative questions.

connections.description: Michael Bachner is the legal representative for the unnamed female client, preparing and submitting an attorney proffer on her behalf and arranging communications with prosecutors.

events.title: Attorney Proffer Meeting Scheduled
events.description: Michael Bachner emails a prosecutor to confirm that his statements in an upcoming meeting about his client are preliminary and intended to be covered under Federal Rules of Evidence 408 and 410.

events.title: Clarification on Epstein Property Visits
events.description: A prosecutor follows up on a meeting, asking for clarification on whether Ms. = ever visited specific Epstein properties beyond his New York mansion and Palm Beach residence.

events.title: Attorney Provides Preliminary Clarification
events.description: Michael Bachner replies that his client stayed in the Paris apartment with her husband on one occasion, and that he will get back to the prosecutor on other questions.

events.title: Attorney Submits Replies to Questions
events.description: Michael Bachner sends attached replies to the prosecutor's questions regarding the attorney proffer.

events.title: Prosecutor Acknowledges Proffer
events.description: A prosecutor acknowledges receipt of the attorney proffer, states it does not change their view of Ms. ='s status, and indicates they will follow up the following week.

events.title: Prosecutor Proposes Direct Client Interview
events.description: A prosecutor writes to Michael Bachner, stating the proffer hasn't changed their view and proposes the next step: a voluntary, direct conversation with Ms. =.

keyFacts: An unnamed female client (Ms. =) of attorney Michael Bachner is the subject of a government inquiry related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The government's questions specifically focus on whether Ms. = visited Epstein's properties, including his New Mexico ranch, private islands, and Paris residence.
Michael Bachner indicated his client stayed in Epstein's Paris apartment with her husband on one occasion.
The government prosecutor stated that attorney proffers submitted did not cause them to change their view of Ms. ='s status.
The proposed next step was a voluntary, direct interview with Ms. =, with the prosecutor expressing flexibility on the format and topics.
